checks.notes: Successfully navigated to Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies section. Leave Policies table is visible with multiple policies including 'Unpaid test' policy.
Formula fields are greyed-out/disabled in the unpaid leave configuration. Fields show 'Basic salary', 'Custom days', and '30' all in disabled state, indicating override from payroll settings.

Clear precedence messaging visible: 'Configured in daily wage calculation setting' link appears above disabled formula fields. Blue alert box states: 'Based on the leave allowance used, deduction adjustment for unpaid leaves will be automatically added in payroll table'.
Successfully navigated to unpaid leave calculation method configuration via Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies > Edit 'Unpaid test' policy.

UI clearly indicates global configuration hierarchy overrides policy-level settings. Disabled formula fields with link 'Configured in daily wage calculation setting' demonstrates the override hierarchy.
Calculation method field displays current values (Basic salary / Custom days / 30) with all fields in disabled state, clearly indicating override status and disabled customization.
Successfully navigated to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility configuration. Section expanded showing table with Vacation45 leave type and Configure button.
Daily wage formula is displayed in EOS configuration table: 'Basic salary + allowances / Custom days'. This matches the expected formula structure.

EOS calculation method and salary components are visible in the Configure modal. Alert box states 'Daily rate is configured in daily wage calculation setting' with View button. Modal shows leave type selection checkboxes and calculation details.
Successfully navigated to leave salary calculation configuration via Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies > Edit policy showing day calculation type settings.

UI indicates day divisor configuration status. Disabled 'Custom days' field with value '30' shows the current divisor setting. The 'Configured in daily wage calculation setting' link indicates this is centrally managed and cannot be overridden at policy level.
Leave salary calculation policy configuration is visible showing the complete formula structure: Basic salary / Custom days / 30, with clear indication of override status through disabled fields.
Successfully navigated to unpaid leave deduction configuration via Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies > Edit 'Unpaid test' policy.

Alert box (blue background) displays daily rate information and deduction behavior: 'Based on the leave allowance used, deduction adjustment for unpaid leaves will be automatically added in payroll table'. This serves as the remarks/information display about the calculation.

Day divisor value '30' is displayed in the disabled 'Custom days' field, indicating a fixed 30-day month calculation basis for unpaid leave deductions, which is appropriate for the configured calculation method.
Successfully navigated to unpaid leave deduction settings via Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies > Edit policy showing calculation method configuration.

Daily rate formula fields are present and visible showing 'Basic salary / Custom days / 30'. The alert box below provides additional context about how the daily rate is used for deduction adjustments.

The disabled state of the formula fields and the central configuration link 'Configured in daily wage calculation setting' indicates the system uses a consistent daily rate calculation method. The alert message confirms rates are calculated based on the leave allowance used, supporting the stored rate concept from leave occurrence month.
Successfully navigated to Settings > Payroll > Daily Wage Calculation section. The section is expanded showing the complete configuration table.

Calculation basis options are available and displayed in the table. Three different calculation types are shown with different day divisors: 30.45 days (Salary proration), 22 days (EOS leave encashment), and 30 days (Unpaid leave deduction), demonstrating support for multiple calculation bases.

All three rows in the Daily Wage Calculation table show 'Basic salary + allowances' as the salary component formula, confirming salary components selection is available and configured consistently across all calculation types.

System demonstrates handling of variable month lengths through different day divisors: 30.45 days (average month accounting for leap years), 22 days (working days), and 30 days (standard month). The presence of 30.45 specifically indicates sophisticated month length handling.
Successfully navigated to End of Service Eligibility configuration via Settings > Payroll > End of service eligibility section. Section expanded with table and Configure button visible.

Salary component option 'Basic salary + allowances' is displayed in the table for Vacation45 leave type, confirming the availability of Basic + Allowances option (one of the two expected options: Basic Only or Basic + Allowances).
Calculation method 'Custom days' is displayed in the table, confirming availability of multiple calculation method options (calendar days, working days, or custom days).

Override indicator present in modal: Blue alert box states 'Daily rate is configured in daily wage calculation setting' with View button. This clearly indicates which leave policies will be affected by the EOS configuration and points to the central daily wage calculation setting.
Successfully navigated to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation section. The Daily Wage Calculation section is expanded showing the configuration table with all three calculation types.

Multiple calculation basis options for proration are visible: 30.45 days (custom days for Salary proration), 22 days (working days for EOS), and 30 days (calendar days for Unpaid leave). This demonstrates all three calculation bases are supported.

Warning/guidance about policy override impact is present in the Unpaid Leave Deduction modal. The modal shows eligible leave types with 'Overwrite calculation in policies' toggle switch and warning message indicating which policies will be affected when the configuration is changed.

Modal displays warning message about impact on policies when configuration changes are made. The 'Overwrite calculation in policies' toggle and associated warning indicate changes will affect active configurations, confirming the system indicates impact on active amounts.
